result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew S. Cook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andrew S. Cook is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andrew S. Cook was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Andrew S. Cook was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions: 

Submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

Pay costs of action and costs of probation.

Maintain full-time employment or full-time school* (or a combination of both). *CORRECTION*
 
No contact with victim without agent permission.

No contact with anyone under age 16 without agent permission. 

AODA assessment and follow through. 

Credit in the event of revocation: Parties stipulate to 106 days.

Dodge Correction Center as the reception center.
302 Days credit.
Not eligible for early release.
Costs remaining to be collected during extended supervision.

Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.

Obey all rules and regulations of the department.

Costs, as indicated on the Assessment Report, remaining as uncollected yet at the time of probation revocation, to be collected by DOC during Extended Supervision.
Same conditions but with the addition of 90 days conditional time on count 3.

miscConds.notes: Court did not impose DNA surcharge on count 3.  *CORRECTION*

timeConds.notes: Without good time but with Huber/work release.

records.addlTxt: (Remaining costs to be collected by DOC during extended supervision, per JOC)

02:30 PM Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Defendant Andrew S. Cook. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. State informs the court of the joint agreement of 1 year probation consecutive to the prison recommendation. Defendant pleas NC. Court colloquy. Factual basis found. State notes there is 302 days credit on prison sentence. 

Court orders on 15CF01: 

4 yr prison in the Wisconsin State Prison
Designates Dodge Correction Center
2 years inital Confinement
2 years extended supervision
302 Days credit.
Not eligible for early release

Conditions:
Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.
Obey all rules and regulations of the department.
Cost will be addressed during extended supervision.

Court Orders on 19CM100:
withhold sentence 
1 year probation consective to 15CF01

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew S. Cook in custody, in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Parties have received PSI. Comments re. PSI by Atty M. Argument by ADA Forehand, joining in agent's request for sentencing. Argument by Atty McDougal, requests probation sentence with conditional jail time. Comment by Court. 

Sentencing:   Count 2: Sentence withheld for 3 years probation. Conditions of probation: Submit DNA sample, pay costs of action and costs of probation, costs for DNA surcharge imposed, no restitution, maintain full-time employment or full-time school (or a combination of both) no contact with victim without agent permission, no contact with anyone under age 16 without agent permission. AODA assessment and follow through. Court informs def of firearm prohibition, civil rights suspension. Credit: Parties stipulate to 106 days in the event of revocation. 

Count 3: Sentence withheld for 2 years probation, 90 days conditional jail time without good time.  Court will allow work release/Huber. Def is to pay costs of action and costs of probation. No DNA surcharge.

Defendant Andrew S. Cook in custody and in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA states parties have resolution with argued sentencing. Def waives right to preliminary hearing. Colloquy on waiver. Court accepts waiver of right to preliminary hearing, binds def over for trial. DA presents information. Colloquy on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights. Def pleads G to count 2 & 3. Further colloquy. Court finds factual basis, accepts def's plea, finds def guilty. Court will order a PSI, to be completed by April 6th. P&P is ordered to send copies to DA and defense counsel.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 03:00 pm. Counts 1 & 4 are dismissed.

Defendant Andrew S. Cook in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A. McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel request further status.  Court sets Feb. 13 at 9.  Status conference scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Andrew S. Cook appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail where he is in custody and with Attorney Lisa A. McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counts 1 and 2 are felonies; 3 and 4 are misdemeanors.  Def pleads NG to counts 3 and 4.  Atty. M asks for status scheduling yet in January; states def is willing to waive the prelim time limits.  Court's colloquy with def re waiver of time limits.  Jan. 28 at 11 for status.  Status conference scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Lisa A. McDougal appeared by phone means for Defendant Andrew S. Cook. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Andrew S. Cook in court, in custody of RCSD.  ADA Forehand states the charges; notes that the complaint has been provided to Atty. McDougal.  Atty. M asks that this initial be adjourned to Jan. 7th; also has to be heard re reduction of bail.  ADA objects to change in bail; notes def is originally from South Carolina and that these charges are significant; believes significant cash is appropriate.  Court keeps bail as set; instructs defense that they may bring their request before Judge Sharp at the AIA on Jan. 7th if they so wish.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
